title: What is a simple leaf with an example? - Quora

response.answer_text: A simple leaf, can be described as a single blade, that is not divided into smaller leaflet. It is always attached to a twig by its stem. The margins or edges may be jagged, smooth, loved or parted. Examples of a simple leaf are: black gum tree, Guava, and mangoes.
Examples of the simple leaf are Black gum trees and Black cherry trees See Black gum leaf:  See Black gum leaf:
